# Optimizer Readme

The optimizer app demonstrates how an optimization process can be run within the Opt4J framework. The functionality is implemented within the `src/main/java` folder of this directory. Please refer to the [Opt4J Documentation/Tutorial](https://sdarg.github.io/opt4j/documentation/3.4.0/tutorial.xhtml) for details on the functionality. The main purpose of the readme here is to document the setup and start of the example application.

## Setup / Prerequisites

The only requirement for running this example is an installation of Java. Since we are using a gradle wrapper to run the application, an installation of gradle is not required.

## Starting the optimizer application

The application is started using the gradle wrapper from this directory (e.g., from a Windows Powershell):

```
./gradlew run
```

In the shell, this should look sth like this:

![ShellStartOpt](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/24762889/435951773-edb65b04-ece8-466b-b921-ea5c444cde46.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..G3cckLTP55lbdMCc14taAC0esUShnpeqzf3kQ4UMkZo)

This should open up the Opt4J Application:

![Opt4JApplication](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/24762889/435952387-13c161e3-2719-4c6f-a017-64309ab7b43e.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..MEyvmquO11OPVX5ezM1SITl6jb2ZmUp-rIF0Bmd70OY)

To start the optimizer example, you should select `Load` in the upper bar and then navigate to this directory to select the `example_config.xml` file, which contains the configuration for an optimization using the components defined in the `src/main/java` folder. The result should look sth like this:

![OptConfigSelected](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/24762889/435953321-95d483f3-62b1-43f2-ae5f-6cb565aa5e94.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..lOpNSeqTvjIiyrbyzq9pfmfILYSrxD-aQSZbha-C8sQ)

Assuming that you have already started the evaluator application (see the [EvaluatorReadme](https://github.com/FedorSmirnov89/dse-example/blob/master/evaluator/README.md)), you can start the application by clicking the `Run` button. This will open up the optimization viewer where you will be able to select various tabs visualizing the progress of the optimization:

![OptimizationVisualization](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/24762889/435954745-30cd8870-0ec7-4385-8a08-4ef8e2de528e.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..K8dvDe563KRQV6GmErvdAVkdWPM0KtaqSfhTztJaOsw)
